channel.title: Posts on junglecode
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on junglecode

item.title: President's Day Drum & Bass Mix
item.description: Mixed live by DJ Noah at the junglecode studio in San Francisco. Track List: Misanthrop – Sidereal Noisia – Block Control Outsourced – G Force Bad Company – Navajo Audio – Sanctum Noisia – Friendly Intentions Hedj + Bloke4d – Spirit Prolix – Skull Snapz Optiv + BTK – Backlash Optiv – Waterboard Audio – Planet Fall Telekinesis – Sacrifice Ed Rush + Optical – Pacman (Upbeats Remix) Bad Company – Planet Dust

item.title: All Drum & Bass Mix for 2012!
item.description: Mixed by DJ Noah at the junglecode studio: Dom&Roland – Flux Mindscape featuring RhymeTime- Sickness (Zero Method remix) Vicious CIrcle, Fierce, Jubei – Fiend Wilkinson – Overdose SubFocus – Stomp Optiv & BTK – Backlash Prolix – Who Run It Spy – Bloodshed Gridlok – Insecticide Rawtekk – Rule of Thumb Fourward – Shitdrum Wilkinson – Pistol Whip Prototypes – Born to Rise Culture Shock – Protection Wilkinson – Tonight

item.title: junglecode & IN2IT present SPL
item.description: junglecode & IN2IT are teaming up to bring you a special night of dark and heavy drum & bass featuring SPL from Portland, Oregon. SPL Freak Recordings * Tech Itch * Barcode * Lost Soul * Portland fluid.focus Primitive Science * SF Robin Weber IN2IT * SF

item.title: TECH ITCH, NOAH, MC DUH @ AFTER GLOW
item.description: UPDATE: Tech Itch was not able to perform at this event due to a family emergency. We wish Mark and his family all the best and look forward to his return to San Francisco at a later date. Tri-Atom & AfterGlow Events presents a special multi-genre event featuring DNB/Jungle/DubStep/House/Breaks/Electronica/Hardstyle/Psytrance/Trance/Happycore/Hardcore/Gabber and other forms of electronic dance music. You can find out more about the other types of music by clicking on the official event website but here at junglecode, you know what we’re all about, and we’re super-excited to see the return of Technical Itch to San Francisco.

item.title: GRIDLOK 421 @ SHELTER
item.description: This is the third year of the annual junglecode 420 event, and with the global economy in the tank, we had our doubts about the feasibility of doing another one. Well, with a LOT of help from our friends at PROJECT 51 and SHELTER, we are so happy to bring back GRIDLOK all the way from Los Angeles to headline the show on Tuesday, April 21 at Underground SF in San Francisco.

item.title: St. Patrick's Day with A*SIDES & MC DUH
item.description: Almost 3 years ago, we presented our first major drum & bass event in San Francisco at the Underground SF. This time, we team up with MC DUH and the SHELTER crew to bring you A.Sides all the way from London, UK. A Sides has been producing music since 1990 and has released over 500 tracks to date. He established his own label Eastside Records in 1996 and since then has remained a consistent figure within the drum and bass scene.

item.title: KLUTE * SAGE * MC DUH * SF
item.description: KLUTE [ Commercial Suicide : UK ] Our first 2009 show will stay true to our original charter: 100% World-Class Drum & Bass. We’ve been trying to book this DJ/Producer for some time now, and the planets finally line up to bring us KLUTE, the boss from Commercial Suicide, all the way from London, UK. This will surely be a stormer! SAGE [ Phylum : Milk : UK ]

item.title: LOWpass | Tech-Itch | Hive | Breakage | FSOUND | 4REAL
item.description: junglecode is teaming up with Bay Area leaders FSOUND and 4REAL to bring you an extraordinary experience. MAIN STAGE: |DNB| Hive (violence,LA), Tech-Itch (techitch,UK), MC Armanni Reign (metalheadz,PHILLY), 4REAL (shelter,SF), DRUM ONE (bbs,NYC) |DUBSTEP| Breakage (digital soundboy,UK), The Others/D-Code (tempa,UK), KOZEE (redline,SF), Axiom MC (shelter), Audio Angel (compression) |LIVE ELECTRONICA| Beatropolis (beatropolis.net,SF) UPSTAIRS: |DUBSTEP| DJG (narco.hz,SF), Kozee (redline,SF), Ultraviolet (redline,SF), |DNB| 4REAL (shelter,SF), DRUM ONE (bbs,NYC), TOUCHPHONICS (mezzanine,SF), THE HEIGHTS (shelter,SF), JET (junglecode,SF)

item.title: junglecode @ SF LOVE FEST 2008
item.description: junglecode is proud to support the San Francisco Bay Area Drum & Bass community at the 2008 Love Fest on October 4. This free event brings hundreds of thousands of electronic music enthusiasts to the Civic center in downtown San Francisco. The junglecode resident DJs will be on the float to help deliver maximum drum & bass pressure. We are also bringing crowd-favorite DJ MAYHEM back to SF for this event.

item.title: New DJ Mix for September (free download)
item.description: Here is a brand-new mix from junglecode resident DJ NOAH (aka Noah Krause) recorded at the junglecode studio today. Download (MP3 format) Here’s the track listing: PsiDream + Pacific – Insecure Break – Dog Soldier AK1200 + Danny Breaks + Gridlok – Porn Star Feeder Propaganda – Mercenary Cooh – Headstomp Limewax – He will find us (SPL Remix) Sect – Into the Abyss Vicious Circle – Between the Lines

item.title: MAYHEM @ junglecode
item.description: junglecode is proud to bring MAYHEM to San Francisco on July 19. Mayhem (aka Anthony Rotella) is a 25 year old dj/producer/label owner/promoter from Atlanta, GA. Founder of 404Audio.com, an Atlanta based record store, distributor, label and website for the local d&b community, and Shadow-Law Recordings, which features: Sinthetix, Rob F, Impulse, Kiko, Noisia, Phace, Break, Misanthrop, Psidream, MC Race One, MC Mecha and Mayhem. He’s toured across the world, playing extensively in Europe, New Zealand, Austrailia, Japan, Canada and Puerto Rico in addition to playing regularly across North America.

item.title: New DJ mix from Jet, fresh from Scotland
item.description: Here’s a new mix for your downloading pleasure. It contains tracks that Jet picked up at Underground Solu’shn in Edinburgh, Scotland last week. Enjoy! http://www.junglecode.com/mp3s/jet_06_26_2008.mp3 Tracklisting: Phace + Rawtakk – Stretch Pack Upbeats – Tin God Phace + Rawtakk – Life Goes On Upbeats + State Of Mind – Deviants Dom & Roland – Minds & Machines Phace – Hot Rock VIP Dom & Roland – Through the Looking Glass

item.title: junglecode in June
item.description: The month of June at junglecode comes with an annual heat-wave. It’s going to be another five dollar all drum & bass extravaganza at the Matador Club (deep inside downtown San Francisco!) 4Real San Francisco No Komply (Chris the Junglist vs. BST-ONE) Trauma Anotha Level primitive science Oakland The Axis (The Doctor vs. Arize) connected bayraves.com norcalnights.com anotha-level.com San Francisco

item.title: Bong-Ra + End.User @ JUNGLECODE
item.description: junglecode and .SYSTEM. Productions bring you the first ever US appearance of… BONG-RA bong-ra.com Live sets from: Pneumatic Detach Hive Records End.User Sublight DJ sets from: Intoner .system. Jet junglecode Noah junglecode Thursday, May 29 DNA Lounge 375 11th Street San Francisco Doors at 9 $7 Advance. $10 at the door. 21+ Advance tickets at dnalounge.com

item.title: JUNGLECODE...now every third Saturday
item.description: This month, we bring you some local heavies… BICOLAS [ SKILLS * DANCERECORDSCOM * SF ] DJ M [ FutureBreaks FM * Still Doin’ It * SF ] RESOLVE [ Reloaded * Neo-Sapians * SF ] ESKAE [ Reloaded * Primitive Science * SF ] Saturday, May 17…and every 3rd Saturday Matador Club 6th & Market St. San Francisco $5 @ the door, 21+ 9:00PM to very late www.junglecode.org

item.title: 2nd Annual 420 Celebration with GRIDLOK
item.description: We had a blast at last year’s junglecode 420 event so we’re doing it again! For this time only, we are having the party at the Matador club on 6th Street in downtown San Francisco. We’re also flying in our favorite (former) SF resident DJ GRIDLOK (Project 51, Violence Recordings) to headline this event. We’ll have other DJ’s on deck to ensure a blazing good time so come on down and celebrate the harvest with us.

item.title: junglecode @ RELOADED
item.description: Many thanks to the North Bay crew for having us play at Reloaded tonight. Big UP to the cool junglists in Petaluma!

item.title: junglecode @ FutureBreaks
item.description: The San Francisco Bay Area institution that is FutureBreaks.FM recently announced the end of their long running Drum&Bass radio show after 10 years on the air. JUNGLECODE crew were fortunate enough to play on one of the last FutureBreaks shows last November. We are a bit saddened to hear of the end of the radio broadcast but are encouraged to hear that the FutureBreaks crew plan to keep their web site updated with their future activities which include podcasts of FutureBreaks shows from the past and future.

item.title: DEMO @ junglecode
item.description: JUNGLECODE MONTHLY 12 This is it! #12 of 12 events on the 3rd Friday of each month. This one will be our final regular monthly event at the el Rincon. El Rincon, 16th & Harrison in SF. We have new projects in progress for 2008! For #12 we’re going out with a bitchin’ ho-ho-ho-holiday party! Guaranteed 5 hours of world-class drum & bass. Only $5.00 cover for this night. Friday, December 21, 9PM – 2AM.

item.title: junglecode press kit now available
item.description: junglecode is a tightly-knit collective of artists, engineers, scientists, and other free thinkers. Our mission is to promote the junglist spirit in music, art, and technology. We are based in San Francisco, California. Please use the correct JUNGLECODE images and text in your flyers and other printed or internet materials. The correct web site to link to is www.junglecode.org. The preferred usage is “junglecode” or “JUNGLECODE” in all lower-case or upper-case letters.

item.title: THERAPY SESSIONS SF DYLAN LIMEWAX END.USER BICOLAS
item.description: JUNGLECODE MONTHLY 11 THERAPY SESSIONS SAN FRANCISCO DYLAN [ Freak Recordings * Metalheadz * UK ] LIMEWAX [ LB * Freak Recordings * Tech Freak * UK ] END.USER [ Sublight * Hymen * Peaceoff * Outbreak * Ohm * AdN * SF ] BICOLAS [ Skills * dancerecords.com * SF ] Located @ El Rincon [16th & Harrison SF] 18+ , Full Bar & Restaurant , 9pm – 2am

item.title: DIGITAL @ junglecode
item.description: This month, we bring you the don: DIGITAL [ Function Recordings * Metalheadz * UK ] Also on deck for this evening: DJ RAISE [ Shelter * SF ] MC DUH [ Shelter * Groundscore * SF ] <!— Digital aka Steve Carr is the primary musical moniker this Ipswich based producer is known exclusively for his “old skool beatz” and “dubby B-lines” but a short conversation and a little investigative listening indicate this is one producer likely to pull a few seriously weighty tricks out of the bag.

item.title: junglecode presents GEIN
item.description: GEIN [ Tech Itch * Evol Intent * Moving Shadow * Freak * Habit ] This month, we bring you more rough and tough drum & bass from Milwaukee, Wisconsin. This event promises to be a heavy dose of hard-core drum & bass tuned specifically for the brave junglists who frequent the outskirts of sonic mayhem. Not to be missed! Also on deck for this evening: BONK RUNAMUCK Located @ El Rincon [16th & Harrison SF]

item.title: junglecode events slideshow
item.description: Here are some flyers from our recent events… This little slide show uses Flash, PHP, and JPEG files. It randomizes the slideshow and to add additional images, you just upload new JPEG files. If you want to make a slideshow of your own, download the sources here. junglecode isn’t just about jungle, we code too.

item.title: GRIDLOK –; END.USER –; BICOLAS
item.description: We remain dedicated to promoting the junglist spirit in music, art, and technology. For this installment of the junglecode monthly event, we originally planned to present the debut SF appearance of CURRENT VALUE. Due to circumstances beyond our control, he had to cancel his entire US tour at the last minute. In order to maintain the high standard of quality that our junglists expect at our shows, we called in ample reinforcements that can effectively maintain proper dubplate pressure.

item.title: junglecode presents Counterstrike
item.description: COUNTERSTRIKE [ Algorythm:Human:Evol Intent:Obscene:Barcode:Outbreak:Moving Shadow – South Africa ] Counterstrike has played an instrumental role in putting South Africa on the world drum ‘n bass map. Justin Scholtemeyer AKA Animal Chin and Eaton Crous AKA 500 Mills, have been active drum ‘n bass DJ’s on the club/rave circuit since the mid Nineties. Counterstrike has been producing drum ‘n bass as a collective since 1998. “We work together because we are into the same type of sound… it does not matter if we did a track together or seperately… it still sounds like Counterstrike.

item.title: Video: DJ Sage @ junglecode
item.description: Here is a Flash video of DJ Sage performing at junglecode on May 18, 2007. Click here to see the video (Requires Adobe Flash Player.) Video footage courtesy of 4DTV.

item.title: Company Truck at junglecode
item.description: COMPANY TRUCK [ Sideways:BlackHoe:RawVision:Darkland:HeadWound ] This month we are offering an extended set from Company Truck @ junglecode on 4 turntables and 2 CD-J’s! It’s time to break in our new 1200Mk5G’s and who better to do it than these local heavies. These guys always bring the heat in a big way! Also on deck for this fine payday evening, local support from the Sunset District… B’Scrivin [ junglejunky.com ]

item.title: Sage & Gridlok in San Francisco
item.description: SAGE [ Phunckateck:Phylum:Groundscore:DC Shoes:Moonshine ] GRIDLOK [ Project 51:Violence:Virus:Hardware ] and running the mic: MC DUH [ Groundscore:Phuturo:Crystal Palace FC] It’s been years since Sage graced the decks in San Francisco and junglecode is proud to be the ones to bring her back. We will also have the one and only Gridlok on deck to make sure this event is not one to be missed. We are starting at 10PM with the junglecode resident DJ’s so don’t be late.

item.title: 420 Harvest Celebration
item.description: To celebrate the harvest on April 20, 2007, junglecode proudly presents… UFO! [ Phunckateck:Sanguine:Thyne Eyes:ufoair.com ] COMPANY TRUCK [ Sideways:BlackHoe:RawVision:Darkland:HeadWound ] This is not your usual monthly event! This time it’s a full-on 420 degree fire pit featuring 100% flammable beats. We are starting at 10PM with the junglecode resident DJ’s so don’t be late. Only $5 before 11PM, $7 after. Located @ El Rincon [16th & Harrison SF]

item.title: VICOUS CIRCLE + ECHO | Renegade Hardware | Freak | Violence | Project 51
item.description: VICIOUS CIRCLE [ Renegade Hardware : Freak : UK ] ECHO [ VIOLENCE : PROJECT 51 : SF] Another monthly installment for the SFBay Drum&Bass Crew! This time it’s a UK + SF junglist mash-up with ample ammunition from Renegade Hardware, Freak & Violence recording artists. We are starting at 10PM with the junglecode resident DJ’s so don’t be late. Hosted by BLEND Located @ El Rincon [16th & Harrison SF]

item.title: SPL + NOAH.D | Lost Soul | Freak | TOV | Renegade | Barcode
item.description: SPL [ Lost Soul : Freak : Tech Itch : Obscene : junglecode ] NOAH.D [ TOV : Renegade : Lost Soul : Nemesis : Gasm : BIOS ] More heavy drum & bass for you and your loved ones. This time, it’s the Oregon Invasion from Lost Soul Recordings. All Killer and No Filler! We are starting at 10PM with the junglecode resident DJ’s so don’t be late.

item.title: First Drum & Bass Mix for 2007
item.description: Here is another studio mix from our prolific junglecode selecter DJ NOAH (aka Noah Krause.) DJ NOAH has been making his mark in the SFBay Drum & Bass scene the old-fashioned way–through honest hard work! His track selection is diverse and his mixing is on point. Download (MP3 format) Here’s the track listing: misanthrop-viperfish break-catch off gridlok-bottomfeeder optive-circa liftin spirits & bonecrusher-solstice xample-mutants ed rush & optical-dna gridlok & el hornet-hollywood

item.title: Flash and Bass
item.description: What do these websites have in common? http://www.reinforcedrecords.co.uk/ http://www.photekproductions.com/ http://www.bigbadbass.com/ http://www.freak-recordings.com http://www.breakbeat.co.uk/ http://www.subscience.org/ http://www.myspace.com/music/ They all run Adobe Flash. junglecode founder Jethro “Jet” Villegas is Sr. Engineering Manager at Macromedia Adobe and an architect of the Flash product. It’s not an accident that the software can handle Heavy Bass — it’s designed to do that and so much more. If you’re thinking about making a killer website, please consider using Flash and help keep the bass moving across the planet.

item.title: junglecode presents GRIDLOK + UFO! + JUJU + MC DUH
item.description: junglecode is proud to announce a new monthly event on the 3rd Friday of each month in 2007. For our first show, we are pleased to present 3 local residents who are largely responsible for putting and keeping San Francisco on the worldwide Drum & Bass map. These producers are world-class performers–exactly as you expect at junglecode shows! GRIDLOK [ Project 51 : Violence Recordings : Virus : Renegade Hardware ]

item.title: Therapy Sessions SF –; New Years Eve
item.description: We are throwing a very very special Therapy Sessions San Francisco New Years Eve party and you’re all invited. No holds barred! A guaranteed minimum 6 hours of non-stop drum & bass starting at 8 PM! $15 all night. More info will be posted here and on groundscore! <!— For a limited time: Click the “Add to cart” button below to order presale tickets at just $10 each via PayPal (safe and secure.

item.title: Jet @ BLEND
item.description: junglecode founder Jet performs on Friday, November 17, 2006 at BLEND, a very bass-heavy weekly event in San Francisco. In the last year, Jet has performed with several world-class Drum & Bass leaders including Loxy & Ink, Dylan, Chase & Status, Limewax, Hive, SPL, UFO! and TeeBee. Also performing on Friday are DJ’s Gringo, Advance, and Audio1. This should be a really fun event with lots of different styles represented.

item.title: junglecode presents TeeBee
item.description: We are bringing out TeeBee [Metalheadz, Subtitles, Prototype, Norway] for an exclusive San Francisco appearance at PHUTURO on November 14, 2006. The date is set and 100 percent confirmed. San Francisco is his first stop on a nation-wide USA tour so please come welcome him in true junglecode style. Thank you SF Drum & Bass crew!

item.title: SPL @ ELEV8
item.description: If you haven’t been asleep during the last year or so, you may have noticed that we’ve been bringing the headliners from the world-famous Therapy Sessions to San Francisco. Well, we’re just getting started. Our next installment for Therapy Sessions SF will be led by none other than SPL (Lost Soul, Tech Itch, Freak, Evol Intent.) Please seek advice from your physician prior to attending this event if you are prone to weakness.

item.title: Limewax + Hive in San Francisco
item.description: junglecode is doing it again. This time, we’re teaming up wih the REFLEX drum & bass crew to bring you Limewax (Freak Recordings, UK) for the first time in the USA. We’re also bringing DJ Hive (Violence Recordings, SF) to the same stage to make sure this is one of the heaviest junglist events you’ll come across in a long time. junglecode and REFLEX DJ’s will also bring the sustained sound pressure levels to support this event.

item.title: junglecode t-shirts now available sold out
item.description: Very Limited Edition t-shirts are now available in black, green, or magenta. Adult medium or large sizes. Printed in the USA on imported fabric. $25.00 each shirt. 100% cotton. $5.00 shipping in the USA. $10.00 shipping outside the USA. 8.5% sales tax added for California residents. <!—

item.title: Exclusive Studio Mix MP3 Download
item.description: Here is another exclusive studio mix from junglecode resident DJ NOAH (aka Noah Krause.) Download (MP3 format) Here’s the track listing: prolix-choke hold break-extreme noisia-subdue upbeats-stick together noisia-facade subfocus-verano chase & status-the druids vicious circle-doom train(optiv remix) spor-lose it upbeats-white tail ink & dylan-need you(phobia remix) total science-sqaush(gridlok remix) aries-herb smoke(tc remix) dillinja-expansions amit-swaskita tech itch-raised by evil hive, gridlok and calyx-event horizon spl-grey dream noisia & mayhem-moonway renegade

item.title: Chase & Status in San Francisco
item.description: junglecode is extremely proud to present Chase and Status [ BBK | BC Presents | Bingo | UK ] for their first ever San Francisco appearance at PHUTURO on June 20, 2006. Do not sleep on this one because “first ever” only happens once. This duo has been tearing up the drum & bass circuit with dubplate rotation from the likes of Andy C, Mampi Swift, Friction, Zinc, Pendulum, Fabio and Bad Company all showing huge support for their releases.

item.title: Get Therapy this Summer
item.description: We are very proud to present Therapy Sessions San Francisco this summer in cooperation with Anger Management UK and Freak Recordings. More details will be announced here so check back regularly. SF Drum & Bass is alive and well. We don’t sleep.

item.title: Dylan in San Francisco
item.description: That’s right, junglecode readers. Our Ink & Loxy event was so successful that we can’t just leave it alone. We are bringing out Dylan [Tech Freaks, Freak, Obscene, UK] for an exclusive San Francisco appearance at PHUTURO on May 2, 2006. Details are still getting firmed up, but the date is set and 100 percent confirmed. Ask for your vacation days now, because you will need them after Dylan is through with you.

item.title: Exclusive mix from DJ Noah
item.description: We are pleased to announce our newest junglecode resident DJ NOAH (aka Noah Krause) from deep in the jungles of the Western Addition in San Francisco. DJ NOAH will be appearing alongside DJ DYLAN on May 2, 2006 at PHUTURO. Here is an exclusive studio mix recorded on June 14, 2006. Download (MP3 format) Here’s the track listing: corrupt souls-skyclad the chosen-out of the dark quadrant-closure noisia, mayhem, & mc verse-choke

item.title: DJ Ink and Loxy —; A Pi Day Celebration!
item.description: March 14, 2006 was Pi Day in San Francisco and all over the cosmos. To celebrate this important value, junglecode teamed up with PHUTURO to bring these two awesome DJ/Producers to San Francisco on that evening at the Underground SF. We even gave away a bunch of Ink & Loxy records (which would not exist where it not for the discovery of the ratio of a circle’s diameter to its circumference.

item.title: DJ Hive at Phuturo
item.description: DJ Hive was headlining the weekly Phuturo night last Tuesday, December 13, 2005. The junglists of San Francisco are so fortunate to have such heavy hitters living and making music in the city. It was clear that the local crowd wanted to hear the latest dubplates and DJ Hive did not disappoint. Watch out for the Human Violence tour featuring Hive and Dieselboy — it’s going to be Heavy!

item.title: Inneractive Spirit
item.description: junglecode crew would like to thank DJ Spirit for blowing the roof off Phuturo last week. He played an excellent mix of his own dancefloor-smashing anthems along with some wickedness we’ve never heard before. A solid 2-hour set! DJ Spirit is moving Inneractive Music in a big way with a brand-new web site and fresh beats. The new site is a work in progress and is sure to evolve over time (as Spirit himself has done effectively.

item.title: Digital & Spirit in San Francisco
item.description: The SF jungle scene is about to get a dose of some very heavy drum and bass from none other than acclaimed producers Digital & Spirit, making an appearance at Phuturo in November and December. Both of these artists have individually, and in collaboration as Phantom Audio, pioneered the sound we now associate with UK Drum & Bass. Don’t make the stupid mistake of missing either of these artists as they come into our neighborhood.

item.title: Big Bud in San Francisco
item.description: junglecode crew would like to thank Big Bud for providing an excellent night of melodic drum and bass to San Francisco on November 5, 2005. This was his first SF appearance and he did not disappoint. We look forward to meeting him again in the near future. If you ever get a chance to see Big Bud play out, please do so without hesitation.

item.title: DJ Dylan in the O.C.
item.description: junglecode crew took a trip to Orange County to participate in the Macromedia MAX conference. As if the stars lined up in the cosmos, DJ Dylan is in Orange County as well. There’s no way we’d miss an opportunity to see and hear some of the most wicked beats on earth, so we trek down to Westminster to the ZenOne crew’s party at Bleu. Big UP to Dylan for rocking it in the O.

item.title: junglecode on Hawaii Radio
item.description: If you find yourself on the Big Island of Hawaii, you can now enjoy some junglecode on FM radio from 2 to 4 PM on Thursdays (Hawaii time.) Big up to DJ Search One for broadcasting in the 808 area code. If you’re not in Hawaii, you can hear the web stream on the University of Hawaii server. If that doesn’t work, you’ll have to catch a plane to Hawaii to hear the broadcast.

item.title: junglecode on myspace.com
item.description: http://www.myspace.com/junglecode This blog is still the primary hub for all things junglecode, but we just put up a little page for the myspace heads out there. Be our “friend” if you have a myspace…be our friend if you don’t.

item.title: More Drum & Bass for your Face
item.description: Here’s another brand new jungle mix from DJ Search One recorded at the junglecode studio yesterday. A nice variety of styles here to fill all your bass requirements: Stream Download And if that’s not enough, have another Search One set recorded earlier last week: Stream Download

item.title: Does anybody care about Drum & Bass anymore?
item.description: Well, we do. We care enough to spread a significant bit of junglist history for the curious. The junglecode crew would like to publicly thank the pioneers from back in the day. The infamous “Amen” break that inspired thousands of DnB tunes was originally recorded by the Winstons in the late sixties. The equally important “Apache” break was recorded by the Incredible Bongo Band in the early seventies. Interestingly, their version of “Apache” was also a cover of an original song performed by Bert Weedon in 1960.

item.title: An exclusive jungle mix from DJ Search One
item.description: Wow! Another jungle DJ mix recorded at the junglecode studio last May. You’re in for a real treat this time. This one is an exclusive set from DJ Search One of San Francisco, California. This set is all killer and no filler! Try this link first, if it doesn’t work, use this one. (MP3 format) DJ Search One has been part of the junglecode crew since we started back in 1998.

item.title: New jungle mix for 2005
item.description: Here’s a Jungle DJ mix that was recorded today. Try this link first, if it doesn’t work, use this one. (MP3 format) Featuring the following artists: Amit – Sound Warrior Digital – Termite SKC & Chris Su – Desert Siege Hive – Futura SKC & Chris Su – Crash Hive – SoundClash Hive – The Raw Uncut

item.title: My favorite drum and bass website
item.description: I went to see Dylan and Technical Itch play a few weeks ago at the subscience event in San Francisco. Dylan’s web site, freak-recordings.com, is easily my favorite drum and bass website right now. He uses Flash too, so it’s quite a thrill for me…like he’s playing my dubplates or something.
